title: Rate limits for a zone
description: Rate limits configured for a zone.
cfExtendedDescription: Note: To configure the new rate limiting rules based on the Ruleset Engine you must use the [Account rulesets](#account-rulesets) or [Zone rulesets](#zone-rulesets) API endpoints. For more information, refer to [Rate limiting rules](https://developers.cloudflare.com/waf/rate-limiting-rules/) in Developer Docs.

links.title: Get rate limits
links.description: Fetches the rate limits for a zone.

page.description: The page number of paginated results.

per_page.description: The maximum number of results per page. You can only set the value to `1` or to a multiple of 5 such as `5`, `10`, `15`, or `20`.

links.title: Create a rate limit
links.description: Creates a new rate limit for a zone. Refer to the object definition for a list of required attributes.
links.curl:
curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/rate_limits" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b59","disabled":false,"description":"Prevent multiple login failures to mitigate brute force attacks","match":{"request":{"methods":["GET","POST"],"schemes":["HTTP","HTTPS"],"url":"*.example.org/path*"},"response":{},"headers":[{"name":"Cf-Cache-Status","op":"ne","value":"HIT"}]},"bypass":[{"name":"url","value":"api.example.com/*"}],"threshold":60,"period":900,"action":{"mode":"challenge","timeout":86400,"response":{"content_type":"text/xml","body":"<error>This request has been rate-limited.</error>"}}}'

id.description: The unique identifier of the rate limit.

disabled.description: When true, indicates that the rate limit is currently disabled.

description.example: "Prevent multiple login failures to mitigate brute force attacks"
description.description: An informative summary of the rate limit. This value is sanitized and any tags will be removed.

methods.description: The HTTP methods to match. You can specify a subset (for example, `['POST','PUT']`) or all methods (`['_ALL_']`). This field is optional when creating a rate limit.

items.description: An HTTP method or `_ALL_` to indicate all methods.

schemes.description: The HTTP schemes to match. You can specify one scheme (`['HTTPS']`), both schemes (`['HTTP','HTTPS']`), or all schemes (`['_ALL_']`). This field is optional.

items.description: An HTTP scheme or `_ALL_` to indicate all schemes.

url.description: The URL pattern to match, composed of a host and a path such as `example.org/path*`. Normalization is applied before the pattern is matched. `*` wildcards are expanded to match applicable traffic. Query strings are not matched. Set the value to `*` to match all traffic to your zone.

origin_traffic.description: When true, only the uncached traffic served from your origin servers will count towards rate limiting. In this case, any cached traffic served by Cloudflare will not count towards rate limiting. This field is optional.
origin_traffic.cfNotes: This field is deprecated. Instead, use response headers and set "origin_traffic" to "false" to avoid legacy behaviour interacting with the "response_headers" property.

name.description: The name of the response header to match.

op.description: The operator used when matching: `eq` means "equal" and `ne` means "not equal".

value.description: The value of the response header, which must match exactly.

match.description: Determines which traffic the rate limit counts towards the threshold.

bypass.description: Criteria specifying when the current rate limit should be bypassed. You can specify that the rate limit should not apply to one or more URLs.

threshold.description: The threshold that will trigger the configured mitigation action. Configure this value along with the `period` property to establish a threshold per period.

period.description: The time in seconds (an integer value) to count matching traffic. If the count exceeds the configured threshold within this period, Cloudflare will perform the configured action.

timeout.description: The time in seconds during which Cloudflare will perform the mitigation action. Must be an integer value greater than or equal to the period.
timeout.cfNotes: If "mode" is "challenge", "managed_challenge", or "js_challenge", Cloudflare will use the zone's Challenge Passage time and you should not provide this value.

content_type.description: The content type of the body. Must be one of the following: `text/plain`, `text/xml`, or `application/json`.

body.description: The response body to return. The value must conform to the configured content type.

response.description: A custom content type and reponse to return when the threshold is exceeded. The custom response configured in this object will override the custom error for the zone. This object is optional.
response.cfNotes: If you omit this object, Cloudflare will use the default HTML error page. If "mode" is "challenge", "managed_challenge", or "js_challenge", Cloudflare will use the zone challenge pages and you should not provide the "response" object.

action.description: The action to perform when the threshold of matched traffic within the configured period is exceeded.

links.title: Get a rate limit
links.description: Fetches the details of a rate limit.

links.title: Update a rate limit
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/rate_limits/372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b59" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"id":"372e67954025e0ba6aaa6d586b9e0b59","disabled":false,"description":"Prevent multiple login failures to mitigate brute force attacks","match":{"request":{"methods":["GET","POST"],"schemes":["HTTP","HTTPS"],"url":"*.example.org/path*"},"response":{},"headers":[{"name":"Cf-Cache-Status","op":"ne","value":"HIT"}]},"bypass":[{"name":"url","value":"api.example.com/*"}],"threshold":60,"period":900,"action":{"mode":"challenge","timeout":86400,"response":{"content_type":"text/xml","body":"<error>This request has been rate-limited.</error>"}}}'

disabled.description: When true, indicates that the rate limit is currently disabled.

description.example: "Prevent multiple login failures to mitigate brute force attacks"
description.description: An informative summary of the rate limit. This value is sanitized and any tags will be removed.

cfLinkErrors.10002: Rate limit not unique (edit the existing rather than adding a new)
cfLinkErrors.10015: Patch value not valid for given context

object_definition.title: Rate limits for a zone
object_definition.description: Rate limits configured for a zone.
